comments:
Java core when moving or dragging an input dialog.

The enclosed Java core file was created from a workbench crash when moving an 
input dialog following the below scenario.  The run-time configuration includes:

-Java runtime (JRE) or Java development kit (JDK) 1.4 
-Eclipse SDK 3.0.1 for Linux (GTK) , Linux (Motif), or Windows 
-Eclipse Modeling Framework (EMF) SDK 2.0.1 
-XML Schema Infoset Model (XSD) SDK 2.0.1 
-Hyades run-time 3.2.0
      -Hyades Runtime 
      -Hyades Component Test 
      -Hyades Data Collection Engine 

Steps to reproduce:
1) Start the Hyades Data Collection Engine. 
2) Start profiling the local processor time in the Hyades workbench (Run > 
Profile... > Host - Windows (Perfmon) > New > Profile > <right click on 
<monitoring> Profiling> > Open With > Statistical Data > Windows Perfmon Trace 
> <right click on Windows Perfmon Trace> > Configure Statistical Data 
Collection Counters > <right click on Processor> > Get child counters > <right 
click on 0> > Get child counters > <right click on Processor Time> > Start 
tracing this counter > OK).
3) Click on the Graphs tab and select the More cell for the Processor Time row.
4) Move or drag the Configure Graph dialog and note the workbench crash.
3)

It doesn't really matter which VM you try.  Just checking to see if the 
problem is VM dependant.  Using any 1.4.2 stable VM would be a good choice.

Paul:
1. You mention GTK and Motif in the description. Do you also crash on these 
platforms?
2. Can you confirm you are using Windows XP?
3. Do you also crash with Eclipse 3.1 M5a?
4. Can you erase your paste the workspace/.metadata/.log file - then 
restart/crash Eclipse and paste here your new .log file? Maybe some out of 
memory exception was reported.
5. Can you self host Eclipse, run it in the debugger and put a Java Exception 
breakpoint for 'SWTException'. Try to crash. Which SWTException was thrown?

Hi Christophe,

Here are the answers to your questions:
1. You mention GTK and Motif in the description. Do you also crash on these 
platforms?

The GTK and Motif references are in the configuration information for the 
Eclipse platform and not used in this scenario (e.g Eclipse SDK 3.0.1 for Linux 
(GTK) , Linux (Motif), or Windows).  This problem was found using Windows XP 
Professional Version 2002 SP1.

2. Can you confirm you are using Windows XP?

Yes, this problem was found using Windows XP Professional Version 2002 SP1.

3. Do you also crash with Eclipse 3.1 M5a?

Are you having problems replicating this defect?  

Yes, the Eclipse 3.1 M5a build also crashes (see 
javacore.20050307.205821.3704.zip) using the following JRE:

IBM Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2)
Classic VM (build 1.4.2, J2RE 1.4.2 IBM Windows 32 build cndev-20040524 (JIT ena
bled: jitc)) 

4. Can you erase your paste the workspace/.metadata/.log file - then 
restart/crash Eclipse and paste here your new .log file? Maybe some out of 
memory exception was reported.

No new entries are logged.

Created an attachment (id=18523)
javacore.20050307.205821.3704.zip

From the stack trace is seems that you have disposed an image that is still in 
use by GraphTable, a subclass of Table.  I'm not sure why the javacore's 
didn't give better information but the last stack trace shows what is 
happening.  Anyway, this is a programming error.  You shouldn't do it.
Redirecting to Hyades for a fix.

There is insufficient time left in 3.3 to have a specific fix for this problem
but  this code has been refactored in 4.0 and does not suffer from the same
problem.  If the problem does resurface then this bug will be reopened in the
latest stream (e.g. 4.x)
Verified in the TPTP 4.0 (HEAD) build (200505090100) on May 9, 2005.
Closing.
